page.title: 04THORNTON RESERVOIR
page.content: The view of Thornton Reservoir seen from St.Peter's church through Beech and Ash trees is beautiful.There are seventy-five acres of water and three miles of bank.It attracts many people. This unfortunately prevents the Reservoir from being famous for it's wildlife.Common water fowl are found also Tufted ducks,Great Crested Grebes and Ruddy ducks.In the past six years a pair of Ospreys have been seen on the Reservoir.Trout fishing is run by a South Wales company. The Reservoir is stocked with Rainbow and Brown Trout.There are nineteen boats.A season ticket costs Â£147.A day ticket costs Â£5.75p. On average there are twenty fishermen a day.
